page.title: 17MRS.JOSEPH'S INTERVIEW
page.content: FIONA AND SARAH INTERVIEWED MRS. JOSEPH OUR SCHOOL CARETAKER WHO HAS LIVED HERE FOR 27 YEARS. HER HUSBAND WAS BORN IN THE VILLAGE AND WENT TO OUR SCHOOL. IT WAS THEN THE OLD BUILDING WITH TWO CLASSROOMS. THE CHILDREN WENT TO THE R.A.F. CAMP FOR LESSONS WHILE THE NEW SCHOOL WAS BEING BUILT TO CATER FOR THE INCREASING NUMBERS IN 1974. SHE REMEMBERS THE RAILWAY STATION USED BY THE R.A.F. AND VILLAGERS UNTIL IT WAS ONE OF THE FIRST TO BE CLOSED BY DR. BEECHING IN THE LATE FIFTIES. THERE WERE NO SHOPS, GARAGE, STREET LIGHTS OR POST OFFICE UNTIL THE 1960'S. PEOPLE WENT TO TOWN BY DOUBLE DECKER BUS FROM THE ONLY BUS STOP. MRS. JOSEPH BOUGHT TWO COTTAGES IN 1957 FOR Â£900 AND MERGED THEM INTO ONE. SHE DOESN'T KNOW THEIR AGE BECAUSE THERE ARE NO DEEDS.
